com.yantra.api.ycp.workflow

Interface raiseEvent

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCPApi, YIFApi

    public interface raiseEvent

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document raiseEvent(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The raiseEvent invokes an event handler.

    • Method Detail

      • raiseEvent

        org.w3c.dom.Document raiseEvent(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The raiseEvent invokes an event handler. The raiseEvent API can be called to signal various business events or exceptions.

        If the SendToAlertConsole event handler is selected, the data passed in the KeyMap of the input xml is used to populate the YFS_INBOX table.

        Additional Information

        When event is invoked for specific enterprise, then it is raised for that enterprise as well as for DEFAULT, if event handle of event is configured for both. Invocation of event can be suppressed for DEFAULT in such scenarios if yfs.forceraiseevent.default is set to N.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSAddAdditionalKeyDataUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions:
        The requested event handlers are invoked.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
